author: george
title: Gender Unicorns CNFT card game
description: There is a need for interactive CNFT games with a strong social impact.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal adheres in all important areas to the guidelines and objectives of the overall Challenge and claims to be a project that will solve important social problems. The project is described in great detail, but this results in a flood of information that demands the utmost attention. A compression of the contents would be very helpful for the reader. The actual idea of the game has a very high social demand related to gender equality, social diversity and tolerance. If the game were to find a high level of acceptance among the player community, this would certainly create a noticeable added value for the Cardano ecosystem. However, Cardano is not mentioned enough in terms of the amount of information. CNFT's application and ADA payment options serve as a bridge here. Some of the roadmap elements in this chapter are more likely to be found in the feasibility chapter.
f6_assessments.q1: This section lists very briefly what the timetable should look like. However, I do not see any concrete information about a time frame. There are references to Github and Jira for highlighting important milestones, but without active links; this information seems to be reserved for the team. The budget is not particularly high and is explained in detail in terms of man-hours. The team seems to consist of very competent members with strong references, who on the one hand do justice to their tasks and on the other hand also have a connection to the target group.
f6_assessments.q2: It refers to high standards that enable the team management and also the team to monitor processes and to be able to retrieve and monitor progress, work phases and results. Unfortunately, it is not described how the Cardano community should have such access. More transparency would be necessary here.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal reminds me of a card game called Unstable Unicorns and to be honest I’m a huge fan of that game. The proposer has describe the game amazingly detailed. The game catches up with NFT trend, its contents and features are closely related to Cardano so I can confidently say that it strongly aligns with this challenge and has a lot of potential. Through this proposal, I can tell that the team has very deep knowledge about Cardano system and know how to use it as an advantage in this project. The proposer has also addressed clearly its target and its impact on the chosen audience with their reasonable example. And all the audience that the game is aiming to is totally appropriate for the game to achieve its goals and benefit Cardano. Not only does the team has a game idea but also they have a very thorough plan with human resources, marketing strategies, contests and community building to build a solid foundation for the development of the game in the long run. The foreseeable challenge and risks are addressed realistically and very comprehensively. However I don’t find that the team has a direction to solve the problem and in case, those problems actually raise, it’ll effect the project big time. I would suggest the team to discuss it more
f6_assessments.q1: In term of  feasibility, the plan is outlined with clear milestones and those milestones seem to follow closely with the plan. All team members have some certain relevant solid skills and experiences and it will definitely contribute a lot to the success of this project. However I would suggest the team to work on an est. time to achieve these milestones, that way will be easier to follow up with the whole plan. The budget breakdown is built on working hours and it’s a fair point. I find that those expenses are reasonable, but to make it better, it should be align with your working timeline. It’s better to help the community have a justification of the requested amount
f6_assessments.q2: The team has a very completed introductions of the measurement tools and the community can use it as a reliable source to find if it can be audited fairly. It’s a huge plus point here. However, I don’t find a lot of KPIs to audit this project? Every project needs to have its clear KPIs with time-related target for the auditor and the team themselves to have a regular check-up. I don’t think this part is done properly here. If the team can come up with a clear KPI goals, it’ll be more effective in helping the auditor to decide if it’s a success.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal in this part was written so well in my opinion. It covered essential information to be aligned with the challenge. The team has talked about the main features of the game and the main audiences that they are aiming for. More than that, they even talked about impact on each main audiences, which shows that they have made a thorough preparation for the project, they have been so thoughtful of the audiences. Their plan and timeline was also clearly and fully displayed in the proposal. It could be seen easily what were in their marketing strategy, they included 5 pillars and each pillar was explained carefully. The team has also thought about the possible risks in the future. They has come up with the mitigation strategies for those problems. I really appreciate this meticulousness.
f6_assessments.q1: Both detailed plan, timeline and detailed budget breakdown were clearly showed in the proposal. The team has made a list of what tasks would be done by them, and also how much budget they would spend for each task. This is a crucial thing to do when you make a plan to do something. The proposal has also included names of the team members who will make sure that the project will be delivered. The proposer has mentioned some basic information of the team members as a way, I think, to increase the trustworthiness.
f6_assessments.q2: About the way how they measure the progress of the project, the proposer has mentioned some tools such as Google Workspace, Google Drive, Github, Discord, Jira, Nimbus that they would use to coordinate and track their progress. They also said that about data management, they are using a tailor-made GDPR compliant CRM system that helps them to monitor and manage their branding activities. The team has explained what the success looks like to them, talked about what is the most important factor of success. They also gave detailed explanation for 3 phases in their project, what they expect to create in each phase.

f6_assessments.q0: The team is apparently really serious about the project, and this is shown via how they express themselves in the proposal. The team members have provided the readers with highly detailed planning, and they do an excellent job of grouping that into smaller categories so that the people who read have a better grasp on what they are aiming for. The numbers given are on-point and play a great role in further persuading and making people interested. They even list the difficulties they are facing, and have the strategies ready to issue these risks. This shows that they have a professional attitude toward work. In conclusion, excellent execution of the part.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal has given the readers an extremely detailed breakdown onto the budget and how they would use that budget for which part of the job. The information about the key members of the team mostly tells the spectators every basic thing they need to know about the individuals behind the project, what they do and what they have achieved. However, it seems that the plan and timeline given of the project are still pretty basic and have only the outline. That being said, the proposal has room to grow, so more information will continue to be updated. Other than that, this is a great presentation.
f6_assessments.q2: The team members have given care to all the parts of the proposal to keep the readers intrigued by the project they are on. And this particular part is no exception. They provide the spectators with an abundance of what they are doing to keep track of their progress. They even give the spectator an interesting concept of “SDG Rating”, and although it is still incomplete, I can see that it is a novel concept and it will do well as a boost of motivation for every member of the team when doing the project. In general, an excellent proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
The issue mentioned in this proposal is about gender. I find this idea interesting in terms of creating a playground where multiple gender communities come together to get to know each other better.

Today people still do not fully accept multiple genders and these people often feel lonely in society. Creating a community like this will help people regardless of gender feel like they belong and play games to share in the fun. In addition, it also helps people understand and sympathize with each other instead of avoiding it. 
The proposal outlines the audience the game is aimed at and what the game will bring to them. They want to promote a community that respects all genders today.
Players will own NFT cards to play or can rent NFT to earn income in $ADA.        

To be able to solve the challenge raised, the team has a professional team and a marketing strategy consisting of 5 parts.

First, they will create a list of influencers on social platforms through selection to be able to spread the project.
Second, they use outreach emails to find potential customers through email lists of websites with information related to NFT, gender, and so on.
The third part they use Pay Per Click advertising because their team has 2 people has over 20 years of experience in it. Thanks to that, they will focus on building brands on Google, Facebook, and a few other social platforms such as Twitter, .
Part four will run regular contexts to expand the userbase and will reward good and meaningful ideas that help grow the community.
Finally, the important part for them is community building. They want the community to be built on a solid foundation, safety, and mutual respect. Community moderators and speakers will be voted on by everyone to be fair.

The team presented possible challenges along with suitable solutions. They have prepared contingency plans in case the project encounters any problems very carefully.
f6_assessments.q1:
As for the feasibility, I have a small suggestion that the team should come up with milestones along with a specific time that the measurement team wants to achieve. It can be divided into periods in each quarter and specific tasks during that period. If details can be given, project progress can be better tracked.        
The team also provides a detailed table with each work required to build the project quite reasonably. They also have a team with many years of experience in the areas needed to develop the project.


        They also have a team with many years of experience in the areas needed to develop the project. But I don't know if I'm wrong because I don't see any mention of someone with blockchain experience. This confused me a bit because if the team included someone with blockchain experience, it would help the proposal get more credibility
f6_assessments.q2:
The team uses several tools to manage their projects such as Google Workspace, Github, Jira, Discord, and so on.

They always uphold the important goal of developing a strong, vibrant and inclusive community for people of all genders.

The team also came up with a number of NFTs to measure the success of the project.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is about Gender Unicorns, the first CNFT game promoting gender diversity, equality acceptance to foster interaction and have a strong social impact. 
with the impact, there will be a positive impact on the following groups of people:
1. Marginalized people of various gender identify who need support and understanding - under-represented minorities will find a home in Gender Unicorn's alliances and will be able to express themselves and meet others in fun, engaging, and rewarding ways. 
Casual games (mobile, browser games)- casual games will find an easy-to-learn gaming experience that requires little time commitment but offers high challenges in an intuitive environment directly on the web browser. 
The proposer has outlined a number of relevant infrastructure to address the challenge, such as KPIs being the diverse experienced and dedicated team. Team of good people working to achieve goals. Email outreach to 1000s of websites such as news media, social justice, NGOs etc. Rewards won will be monetary rewards in $ADA ; exclusive access to private community channels, voting rights to important project decisions, etc. Main challenges/risks include unstable macroeconomic and regulatory environment which may affect the tech advancement of both the crypto and NFT market; the invasion of Ukraine and global and political instability affects workforce, a few mentioned among many listed. Solution to these risks are in the proposal.  I agree that the challenge is effectively addressed, hence my rating is 4.




;
f6_assessments.q1:
The milestone of the project is outlined in the proposal as Reward and promotion programs, community build-up, outreach and partnership Gender alliance battles, Unicoin's integration and rewards, etc. 
The budget breakdown is quite detailed showing costs of wallet NFT, Selector screens, Unibet main interface, etc. Total budget is USD51400 which is quite reasonable.
The team is made up of 9 people with varied skills and experiences as Lead Character designer, Lead Graphic designer, Visual development, Software developer and DevOps. 
All the information provided here justifies 4 star rating. I agree that the project will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal stated that they will use the tools listed for tracking progress of work- Google workspace, Google Drive, GitHub , Discord , Jira and Nimbus. 
Success will be determined by the metrics broken down into social impact, minting economics and gaming adoption.
With the social impact, they foresee to 
 have 30,000+ discord members within 2 months of launching, 1000 participants in the dedicated gender channels, 100,000 + gender channel participants, etc. its a new proposal. All the information provided is sufficient for successful auditing. My rating is 4.

f6_assessments.q0: The focus of this project does not appear to be on gaming or growing Cardano or enticing gamers, but rather on pushing gender politics.  While Cardano is an open infrastructure welcoming anyone to utilize it, using Catalyst to fund "projects" that appear to be for-profit NFT sales combined with heavy-handed controversial political agenda  does not seem appropriate.
f6_assessments.q1: Given the qualifications of the team it seems likely they can implement a successful project, but since the majority of the project seems to be not furthering Cardano or gamers but rather "...to give particular attention to the issue of recognizing the right of gender identity of all human beings" i have reservations as to how the "success" of this project is about Cardano or crypto.
f6_assessments.q2: While the creators place lofty goals such as "we foresee to have 100,000+ discord members and more than 10,000+ gender channel participants" it appears that this project is ultimately a for-profit generative NFT sale to fund the proposer's political ideology dissemination using Catalyst funds.  Assuming that 100,000 people will show up for this seems quite optimistic, and it does not appear the "success" indicators are a significant benefit to Cardano's goals.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal states a problem that seems arbitrary to games. People look for entertainment, achievement, and community in games. And in crypto games, the ability to earn. However, there is a market for everything and Gender Unicorns probably has a market for them. The proposal looks to onboard people outside of the crypto space which aligns with the Challenge's goals. Lending feature is interesting and could become a source of income or a business opportunity for owners, should the game be successful.
f6_assessments.q1: The budget mentions Alliance chats and strategy rooms requiring 20WH/$2000 to complete. Based on my experience in the NFT space, Discord has been the go-to for this purpose. A successful crypto game, Splinterlands, uses Steemit and Reddit for their discussions. The proposal would benefit from including what they are looking to build with these chat rooms and how it is unique. The proposal has included a roadmap that is interesting: lending of assets, auto matchmaking, currency integration, etc. But while the team members have impressive backgrounds, it is a little concerning to see no one specialising in game development. Creating games is a discipline in itself and factors like the meta and the balance of strategies are considered important. This proposal would benefit from divulging more into this aspect of the project.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal should tamper expectations on social engagement. Clay Mates, one of the most popular NFT projects on Cardano, has 38k members on their Discord but it took them months. DEADPXLZ is a much anticipated game on Cardano and it 13k Discord members. Cornucopias, another upcoming game, 23k members. Engagement and participation is something that can be worked on through marketing, but it's ultimately out of creators' control. Maintaining 200% floor price above mint price is also another target that is impossible to promise without sweeping floor practices. Having more quantifiable success metrics would make the proposal stronger.

solution: Gender Unicorns is the first CNFT game promoting gender diversity, equality, and acceptance via interactive gender alliances
experience: Our core team is of 9 people, of different genders and expertise. You can find more about our team here: https://genderunicorns.com/#team. We have two designers, a backend developer, a director, a CFO, a CMO, a community manager, a performance manager, and a data entry assistant.
